meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I fed my cat some fish.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fed the chickens in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The hungry dog fed on the delicious leftovers.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was fed by the intriguing mystery novel.
meanings.sent5: The fire was fed by the dry wood, roaring brightly.

meanings.sent1: The fed animals were content and happy.
meanings.sent2: The fed children eagerly finished their meals.
meanings.sent3: The fed birds chirped happily in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The fed guests left the party with smiles on their faces.
meanings.sent5: The fed plants grew tall and strong in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The fed horses grazed peacefully in the field.
meanings.sent2: The fed baby slept soundly in her crib.
meanings.sent3: The fed cows mooed contentedly in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The fed students focused better in class.
meanings.sent5: The fed athletes performed well in the competition.

meanings.definition: supplied with something needed or desired
meanings.sent1: The fed workers were equipped with the necessary tools.
meanings.sent2: The fed community received support during the crisis.
meanings.sent3: The fed students had all the resources for their project.
meanings.sent4: The fed garden flourished with care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The fed mind absorbed knowledge like a sponge.
